titleStmt.title: The coblers end, or His (last) sermon being a true relation of that sermon, which was preached in St. Georges Church in Southwark by a cobler last Sabbath day, being the 12. of December, 1641. who most impudently, and insolently stept up into the pulpit, and broached his Brownisticall & erroneous opinions to his auditors. This is none of your lying flashes, but all is most reall truth. His text was taken out of the 30. chapter of Esaiah, and the last verse. For the fire of Hell is ordained from the beginning, yea even for the King it is prepared, &c.
titleStmt.author: Vincent, Humfrey.

titleStmt.title: The coblers end, or His (last) sermon being a true relation of that sermon, which was preached in St. Georges Church in Southwark by a cobler last Sabbath day, being the 12. of December, 1641. who most impudently, and insolently stept up into the pulpit, and broached his Brownisticall & erroneous opinions to his auditors. This is none of your lying flashes, but all is most reall truth. His text was taken out of the 30. chapter of Esaiah, and the last verse. For the fire of Hell is ordained from the beginning, yea even for the King it is prepared, &c.
titleStmt.author: Vincent, Humfrey.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
